data.title: Catherine Charlotte (Bonaparte) Benton (1822-1890)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Caroline (Bonaparte) Benton born 1822 Bordentown, Burlington County, New Jersey, USA died 1890 Richfield Springs, Otsego County, New York, USA including ancestors + descendants + 5 photos + 3 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 29 Dec 2023 | Created 8 Aug 2014

This page has been accessed 4,186 times.

Biography

Caroline was born in 1822. Caroline Charlotte Bonaparte Benton was the Daughter of the former King of Naples and Spain she was confirmed as such by Napoleon III. She was the daughter of Giuseppe BUONAPARTE and Annette Savage. She passed away in 1890. [1]

Hotel Woodruff History, Jefferson County, New York

Caroline, estranged from her husband, resided at the Woodruff Hotel, she taught French to the darlings of Watertown. Her pension from the French Government is confirmed in her life story, the home in Oxbow, NY was built for her by Enos Brainerd (profile available on request). Old newspaper articles in Lewis and Jefferson County New York provides the details.

Sources

↑ Find a Grave, database and images (accessed 06 July 2022), memorial page for Caroline Charlotte Bonaparte Benton (1822–25 Dec 1890), Find A Grave: Memorial #64624540, citing Old Oxbow Cemetery, Oxbow, Jefferson County, New York, USA; maintained by 47305175 (contributor 47305175), three headstone photos.

http://mentalfloss.com/article/27826/last-king-new-jersey-suburban-life-napoleon%E2%80%99s-brother

Matrix - A Journal of the History of Minerals. Matrix Publishing Company, Dillsburg, Pennsylvania, Volume 6, Number 3, Fall, 1998, pages 108-113 - "Zebulon Howell Benton: The Man Who Would Be St. Lawrence Mining King," by Schuyler Alverson - (page 110 - "A Princess in the Northlands") - https://pennminerals.com/matrixv6

A Souvenir of the Thousand Islands of the St. Lawrence River from Kingston and Cape Vincent to Morristown and Brockville. (Second Edition) - Edited and published by Jno. A. Haddock, Watertown, New York, 1896, pages 131-132 (viewable at Ancestry.com)

PHILADELPHIA I VITAL STATISTICS - ANCESTRY.COM

New York, U.S., Arriving Passenger and Crew Lists (including Castle Garden and Ellis Island), 1820-1957, at Ancestry.com (arrived on Ship Bayard on 16 May 1827 - listed as Caroline Delafolie - age 6)

Marriage announcement in Rochester Republican, Rochester, New York, Monday Morning, 19 August 1839 - "At Watertown, Jefferson Co. N. Y. on the 31st ult Zebulon H. Benton, of Oxbow, to Miss Caroline Charlotte, daughter of Joseph Bonaparte, Count de Surviliers [sic]."

1850 census: Caroline C. Benton - Antwerp, Jefferson, New York

1860 census: C. Benton - Ward 7, Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

1863 Septennial Census: Caroline C. Benton - Ward 7, Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Story about Joseph Bonaparte and family in Albany Evening Times, Albany, New York, Saturday, 1 March 1873, page 1, column 6

1880 census: C. C. Benton - Watertown, Jefferson, New York

Story about Caroline in Utica Daily Observer, Utica, New York, Monday Evening, 12 December 1881, page 1 column 5 - "An Ex-King's Daughter"

Obituary in St. Lawrence Republican, Ogdensburg, New York, Wednesday, 28 January 1891, page 3, column 2

Obituary in The Saint Paul Daily Globe, Saint Paul, Minnesota, Tuesday Morning, 3 February 1891, page 7, column 1

Article by William Chapman White in Adirondack Daily Enterprise, Saranac Lake, New York, Thursday, 5 April 1956, page 6, column 4: "Adirondack Manmarks - My Uncle Napoleon"
